Add filtering 'status' and 'project' options to floating ip list

This patch adds filtering '--status' and '--project' options and
also adds '--long' option to floating ip list command.

Co-Authored-By: Ha Van Tu <tuhv@vn.fujitsu.com>
Partially-Implements: blueprint network-commands-options
Closes-Bug: #1614379

subject: Release resource lock when executing reset_stack_status
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-15 09:12:33.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/db/test_sqlalchemy_api.py', 'heat/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': 'Release resource lock when executing reset_stack_status

The heat cmd "heat-manage reset_stack_status {stack_id}" does
not work, because we don't release resource lock, so this change
to release lock to make sure it works.

Change-Id: Ic42ad40e279c4e40da95d9aee35125767e747124
Closes-Bug: #1622533
(cherry picked from commit 4bd9b81fbbaaf3bd3e0294a2143cb4e61b34ece8)
'}]
commit_message:
Release resource lock when executing reset_stack_status

The heat cmd "heat-manage reset_stack_status {stack_id}" does
not work, because we don't release resource lock, so this change
to release lock to make sure it works.

Change-Id: Ic42ad40e279c4e40da95d9aee35125767e747124
Closes-Bug: #1622533
(cherry picked from commit 4bd9b81fbbaaf3bd3e0294a2143cb4e61b34ece8)

subject: Add MULTI_REGION flag and new role
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-13 01:55:22.000000000', 'files': ['features.yaml', 'devstack-vm-gate.sh'], 'message': 'Add MULTI_REGION flag and new role

Currently "multinode" topology is supported in devstack gate,
but unfortunately only single OpenStack region is applicable.

This patch is to add new role "subnode_multi_region" in feature
matrix to enable OpenStack services in subnode(s). To make OpenStack
multi-region gate/check job can work ASAP, only two nodes(one primary
node as RegionOne, one subnode as RegionTwo) will be supported
at first stage.

Environment variable MULTI_REGION is added to make it possible to
setup the multi-region parameters in localrc for RegionOne and
RegionTwo.

This patch has dependency on:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/386072

Change-Id: I2a5f846ec21f67d63efcfc39d449613a86c3081d
'}]
commit_message:
Add MULTI_REGION flag and new role

Currently "multinode" topology is supported in devstack gate,
but unfortunately only single OpenStack region is applicable.

This patch is to add new role "subnode_multi_region" in feature
matrix to enable OpenStack services in subnode(s). To make OpenStack
multi-region gate/check job can work ASAP, only two nodes(one primary
node as RegionOne, one subnode as RegionTwo) will be supported
at first stage.

Environment variable MULTI_REGION is added to make it possible to
setup the multi-region parameters in localrc for RegionOne and
RegionTwo.

This patch has dependency on:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/386072

Change-Id: I2a5f846ec21f67d63efcfc39d449613a86c3081d

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-09 12:37:17.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/hpe/hpe_3par_iscsi.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_hpe3par.py'], 'message': 'HPE3PAR: handle conflict in iscsi host create

One of the step in creating iSCSI VLUN is to create a host on array.
If there are simultaneous requests comming on 3par array for creating
same host, hpe3parclient creates host for first request and returns
HTTP 409 conflict error for others, with error code 73, message "host
WWN/iSCSI name already used by another host". This was not handled by
3PAR iscsi driver and the HTTP exception would propagate up to volume
manager where it would log it. This patch addresses issue by catching
this exception and reusing the same host.

Closes-Bug: #1642945
(cherry picked from commit 9b0c5c4318d3c348ce185a3f4dd94f9e803bf264)

Change-Id: I102409539c9a691c1816a342163dd049855f57da
'}]
commit_message:
HPE3PAR: handle conflict in iscsi host create

One of the step in creating iSCSI VLUN is to create a host on array.
If there are simultaneous requests comming on 3par array for creating
same host, hpe3parclient creates host for first request and returns
HTTP 409 conflict error for others, with error code 73, message "host
WWN/iSCSI name already used by another host". This was not handled by
3PAR iscsi driver and the HTTP exception would propagate up to volume
manager where it would log it. This patch addresses issue by catching
this exception and reusing the same host.

Closes-Bug: #1642945
(cherry picked from commit 9b0c5c4318d3c348ce185a3f4dd94f9e803bf264)

Change-Id: I102409539c9a691c1816a342163dd049855f57da

initiator/connectors/fake.py, but initiator/connectors.py has
not the FakeConnector, so we should obtain FakeConnector
from initiator/connectors/fake.py directly.

Change-Id: I837c120866cfadd5da4e9097b32a0772d83a52fa
"}]
commit_message:
Drop the judgement condition for FakeConnector

Now os-brick is in version 2.0 and it has FakeConnector in it's
initiator/connectors/fake.py, but initiator/connectors.py has
not the FakeConnector, so we should obtain FakeConnector
from initiator/connectors/fake.py directly.

Change-Id: I837c120866cfadd5da4e9097b32a0772d83a52fa

The OneView driver currently allows nodes to use Server Profile
Templates (SPTs) that are marked to use Virtual MACs. This is an issue
because the MAC the machine is going to use will only be specified at
profile application. The driver only works with physical MACs in the
dynamic allocation case. This should be checked in all interfaces'

Change-Id: I5b779ac58ce096a52876bace77702e828aaac711
Depends-On: I21a1ebfc14ec33c661a1e7c7c1dbdcdcab04f119

commit_message:
Adds another validation step when using dynamic allocation

The OneView driver currently allows nodes to use Server Profile
Templates (SPTs) that are marked to use Virtual MACs. This is an issue
because the MAC the machine is going to use will only be specified at
profile application. The driver only works with physical MACs in the
dynamic allocation case. This should be checked in all interfaces'
validations.

Change-Id: I5b779ac58ce096a52876bace77702e828aaac711
Depends-On: I21a1ebfc14ec33c661a1e7c7c1dbdcdcab04f119
Closes-Bug: 1627818
Co-Authored-By: Charlle Daniel <charlledaniel@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>

One of the requirements to achieve assert:supports-rolling-upgrade TC
tag is to provide a "plan that allows operators to roll out new code to
subsets of services, eliminating the need to restart all services on new
code simultaneously".

This commit documents such rolling upgrade procedure in the devref,
which is last outstanding requirement for Cinder.

Change-Id: I562deafcd4bb9f5666cc35ae77a6bf20ab889612
'}]
commit_message:
Rolling upgrade procedure documentation

One of the requirements to achieve assert:supports-rolling-upgrade TC
tag is to provide a "plan that allows operators to roll out new code to
subsets of services, eliminating the need to restart all services on new
code simultaneously".

This commit documents such rolling upgrade procedure in the devref,
which is last outstanding requirement for Cinder.

Change-Id: I562deafcd4bb9f5666cc35ae77a6bf20ab889612

subject: Stabilize Protection Plugin API
revisions:
[{'number': 25, 'created': '2016-12-19 13:12:36.000000000', 'files': ['karbor/tests/unit/protection/test_provider.py', 'karbor/tests/unit/protection/test_glance_protection_plugin.py', 'karbor/services/protection/checkpoint.py', 'karbor/services/protection/protection_plugins/image/image_protection_plugin.py', 'karbor/tests/unit/fake_protection.py', 'karbor/tests/unit/protection/test_cinder_protection_plugin.py', 'karbor/tests/unit/protection/fakes.py', 'karbor/api/v1/restores.py', 'karbor/services/protection/flows/worker.py', 'karbor/services/protection/protection_plugins/noop_plugin.py', 'karbor/tests/unit/fake_bank.py', 'karbor/tests/unit/protection/test_manager.py', 'karbor/services/protection/protection_plugins/server/nova_protection_plugin.py', 'karbor/services/protection/resource_graph.py', 'karbor/tests/fullstack/test_scheduled_operations.py', 'karbor/services/protection/flows/delete_checkpoint.py', 'karbor/utils.py', 'etc/providers.d/noop.conf', 'karbor/services/protection/flows/create_restoration.py', 'karbor/services/protection/resource_flow.py', 'karbor/tests/unit/fake_providers/fake_provider1.conf', 'karbor/exception.py', 'karbor/tests/fullstack/karbor_base.py', 'karbor/api/v1/providers.py', 'karbor/services/protection/flows/create_protection.py', 'karbor/services/protection/provider.py', 'karbor/services/protection/protection_plugin.py', 'karbor/common/constants.py', 'karbor/services/protection/manager.py', 'karbor/tests/unit/protection/test_resource_graph.py', 'karbor/tests/unit/protection/test_build_task_flow.py', 'karbor/services/protection/protection_plugins/volume/cinder_protection_plugin.py', 'setup.cfg', 'karbor/services/protection/protection_plugins/base_protection_plugin.py', 'karbor/tests/fullstack/test_checkpoints.py', 'karbor/tests/unit/protection/test_resource_flow.py', 'karbor/tests/fullstack/test_plans.py', 'karbor/tests/fullstack/test_restores.py'], 'message': "Stabilize Protection Plugin API

Protection plugin now needs to implement methods for each operation
(protect, delete, restore). Each protection plugin is created in the
context of the flow, while each operation is created in the context of
the resource.

A protection plugin is responsible for returning an Operation class for
each operation. Such Operation class defines the behavior of the
protection plugin by implementing these optional hooks:

- on_prepare_begin hook is invoked before any hook of this resource and
  dependent resources has begun
- on_prepare_finish hook is invoked after any prepare hooks of dependent
  resources are complete.
- on_main hook is invoked after the resource prepare hooks are complete
- on_complete hook is invoked once the resource's main hook is
  complete, and the dependent resources' on_complete hooks are complete

HeatTemplate is now created and supplied from a task instead of being
created and passed to resource tasks before the restore operation began.

Change-Id: I847eec6990b2d24a66a12542d242fbfb682272fe
Co-Authored-By: Saggi Mizrahi <saggi.mizrahi@huawei.com>
Implements: blueprint protection-plugin-is-design
"}]
commit_message:
Stabilize Protection Plugin API

Protection plugin now needs to implement methods for each operation
(protect, delete, restore). Each protection plugin is created in the
context of the flow, while each operation is created in the context of
the resource.

A protection plugin is responsible for returning an Operation class for
each operation. Such Operation class defines the behavior of the
protection plugin by implementing these optional hooks:

- on_prepare_begin hook is invoked before any hook of this resource and
  dependent resources has begun
- on_prepare_finish hook is invoked after any prepare hooks of dependent
  resources are complete.
- on_main hook is invoked after the resource prepare hooks are complete
- on_complete hook is invoked once the resource's main hook is
  complete, and the dependent resources' on_complete hooks are complete

HeatTemplate is now created and supplied from a task instead of being
created and passed to resource tasks before the restore operation began.

Change-Id: I847eec6990b2d24a66a12542d242fbfb682272fe
Co-Authored-By: Saggi Mizrahi <saggi.mizrahi@huawei.com>
Implements: blueprint protection-plugin-is-design

commit_message:
SGApp support allowed address pairs

If a lport was configured allowed address pairs,
those addresses should also be took into account when
converting 'remote group' in SG rules into actual network
addresses of VM ports. So packets with the address in a
allowed address pair could also pass through the SG check.

Partially-Implements: blueprint allowed-address-pairs
Change-Id: Ib30a3aab77eebfac0c9b2325bc2a03df828a947c

subject: Make port-aggregation more efficient
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-08-15 01:50:23.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/controller/sg_app.py'], 'message': 'Make port-aggregation more efficient

Currently, _split_range takes O(n^2) to calculate port
aggregation list. This patch reduce the time complexity to O(n)
by first determine the boundary, and aggregate lower part and
upper part respectively. n refers to the bit number of port in the
above context.

Change-Id: Ibf038a18a35e7466b0548cd14a84c7375bb7d0fe
Closes-Bug: 1599752
'}]
commit_message:
Make port-aggregation more efficient

Currently, _split_range takes O(n^2) to calculate port
aggregation list. This patch reduce the time complexity to O(n)
by first determine the boundary, and aggregate lower part and
upper part respectively. n refers to the bit number of port in the
above context.

Change-Id: Ibf038a18a35e7466b0548cd14a84c7375bb7d0fe
Closes-Bug: 1599752

commit_message:
Use six.moves.range for Python 3

The function xrange() was renamed to range() in Python 3. We use
"from six.moves import range" to get xrange() on Python 2 and range()
on Python 3.

Closes-Bug: #1596127

Change-Id: I448941935353d8c85696751cf74ecc6e81b8ef49

commit_message:

we'll be able to test this feature later.

commit_message:

The squashfs format brings a couple of advantages over the other
formats. Image is often an order of magnitude smaller and it can
be used natively, either as an initrd, either with loop mount.

commit_message:
replace logging with oslo_log.

The oslo.log (logging) configuration library provides standardized
configuration for all openstack projects. It also provides custom
formatters, handlers and support for context specific logging (like
resource id's etc).

subject: Activate virtualenv in disk-image-create
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-11-29 19:11:30.000000000', 'files': ['diskimage_builder/disk_image_create.py'], 'message': 'Activate virtualenv in disk-image-create

Because we're still fundamentally a python program calling a
shell-script, there's some oddities like not having the virtualenv
bin/ in the $PATH if we call disk-image-create directly.

We can detect this, however, and activate the virtualenv before we
fork the disk-image-create shell script so everything "just works".

See also nodepool change I0537cbf167bb18edf26f84ac269cbd9c8a1ea6a2

Change-Id: Ibfea6cf6a6fd0c7f1e468d501c61ae0b58992042
'}]
commit_message:
Activate virtualenv in disk-image-create

Because we're still fundamentally a python program calling a
shell-script, there's some oddities like not having the virtualenv
bin/ in the $PATH if we call disk-image-create directly.

We can detect this, however, and activate the virtualenv before we
fork the disk-image-create shell script so everything "just works".

See also nodepool change I0537cbf167bb18edf26f84ac269cbd9c8a1ea6a2

so we should deprecate enable_notifications and

commit_message:
Deprecated enable_notifications and notification_level

The 'enable' option has been removed in sahara, and
the 'level' option does not in the oslo.messaging,
so we should deprecate enable_notifications and
notification_level, and set the notification_driver
 if you wish to enable sahara notifications.

Change-Id: Ibbe5329d621cb6f88787d8943d09749c5ac938f5
Closes-Bug: #1621853

revisions:
[{'number': 22, 'created': '2016-12-15 10:35:14.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/api/contrib/quotas.py', 'cinder/backup/api.py', 'cinder/api/contrib/types_manage.py', 'cinder/api/v3/group_types.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_utils.py', 'cinder/utils.py', 'cinder/api/v1/snapshots.py'], 'message': 'Use method is_valid_boolstr from oslo_utils

Oslo.utils provides same method is_valid_boolstr,
in oslo.utils 3.17,and now we are in oslo.utils>=3.17
,so we should use it directly.

Oslo_utils's is_valid_boolstr accepts "t" and "f" ,
"on" and "off",but Cinder didn't.

The rest api in following will be influenced by this:
     API:  cinder type-update  Parameter:  is-public
           cinder type-create              is-public
           cinder snapshot-create          force
           get_bool_param()                param_string
           cinder backup-list              all-tenants
and unimplemented v3 api:group_types update function, and
corresponding parameter is is_public.

Change-Id: I0326e586fe6c402e3425fa65656821054e560e40
'}]
commit_message:
Use method is_valid_boolstr from oslo_utils

Oslo.utils provides same method is_valid_boolstr,
in oslo.utils 3.17,and now we are in oslo.utils>=3.17
,so we should use it directly.

Oslo_utils's is_valid_boolstr accepts "t" and "f" ,
"on" and "off",but Cinder didn't.

The rest api in following will be influenced by this:
     API:  cinder type-update  Parameter:  is-public
           cinder type-create              is-public
           cinder snapshot-create          force
           get_bool_param()                param_string
           cinder backup-list              all-tenants
and unimplemented v3 api:group_types update function, and
corresponding parameter is is_public.

Change-Id: I0326e586fe6c402e3425fa65656821054e560e40

commit_message:
Purge deleted rows data

Adds the ability to clean up rows that are already marked as
deleted of a certain specified age. Age is calculated as timedelta
from now() in days, which are given at command line.

Change-Id: I5f59ac6b8b00ed93ea23925611b1a7c91f609727
Implements: blueprint clean-deleted-data-in-db

commit_message:
[api-ref] Add max number of characters for tag

The maximum number of characters allowed in a tag is 60. This
is not specified anywhere in the api-ref. This change adds the
limit to the api-ref in the tags section.

Change-Id: I378c14b3cd79fbf2c39e3e4b49ba540a3b983deb
Closes-bug: 1648442

commit_message:
Catch NUMA related exceptions in create server API method

The exceptions are raised by numa_get_constraints() method should be
caught by REST API layer explicitly. If we wouldn't catch them
nova will return responce with 500 status code instead of 400.

Following exceptions were caught:

 * CPUThreadPolicyConfigurationInvalid
 * ImageCPUPinningForbidden
 * ImageCPUThreadPolicyForbidden
 * MemoryPageSizeInvalid
 * MemoryPageSizeForbidden
 * RealtimeConfigurationInvalid
 * RealtimeMaskNotFoundOrInvalid

Closes-Bug: #1636911
Closes-Bug: #1636688

Change-Id: I7c06bb2c3094eee403e615d6027c38502eaabd49

Passing an invalid limit value, for example '--limit -1'
in neutronclient, generates this error from the API:

  Bad limit request: Limit must be an integer 0 or
  greater and not '%d'.

It should print what was passed.

Change-Id: I9b8bd67d344cd91e008f7c897f1ea6a020a9c30b
"}]
commit_message:
Correctly print --limit value passed via API

Passing an invalid limit value, for example '--limit -1'
in neutronclient, generates this error from the API:

  Bad limit request: Limit must be an integer 0 or
  greater and not '%d'.

It should print what was passed.

Closes-bug: #1649665

Change-Id: I9b8bd67d344cd91e008f7c897f1ea6a020a9c30b

This patch adds a first set of tests for the PCI-DSS feature.
The tests included are related to:
- user account lockout
- password history requirements

It also fixes the behavior of the "test_users" API tests to
handle the environment with the PCI-DSS settings enabled.

We rely on the "security_compliance" feature flag, a follow
up patch in DevStack enables the required settings in

tests and enables the feature flag.

Change-Id: I59fba9391f77dba026cce79d5fec9cb32c6bb72c
'}]
commit_message:
PCI-DSS tests

This patch adds a first set of tests for the PCI-DSS feature.
The tests included are related to:
- user account lockout
- password history requirements

It also fixes the behavior of the "test_users" API tests to
handle the environment with the PCI-DSS settings enabled.

We rely on the "security_compliance" feature flag, a follow
up patch in DevStack enables the required settings in
keystone at the same time that sets the configs for the tempest
tests and enables the feature flag.

Change-Id: I59fba9391f77dba026cce79d5fec9cb32c6bb72c

commit_message:
Remove Kaminario deprecated option

In Newton release, "kaminario_nodedup_substring" option
was marked deprecated in Kaminario driver and needs to be
remove in Ocata release.

Also, use "CONF.register_opts" for
"auto_calc_max_oversubscription_ratio" to add this option
automatically in driver specific options table for the
config-reference OpenStack manual for Kaminario driver.

Change-Id: Ic0842f99d54fa326d81eb62b270a2d312b9f986f
Co-Authored-By: Nikesh Mahalka <Nikesh.Mahalka.ctr@kaminario.com>

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-11-30 06:02:48.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/common/utils/linux/remote_client.py', 'tempest/scenario/test_volume_boot_pattern.py', 'tempest/common/preprov_creds.py', 'tempest/config.py', 'tempest/cmd/account_generator.py', 'tempest/scenario/test_baremetal_basic_ops.py', 'tempest/lib/cli/base.py', 'tempest/test.py'], 'message': "Modify variable's using method in Log Messages

String interpolation should be delayed to be handled by the logging code,
rather than being done at the point of the logging call.
Ref:http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#log-translation
For example:
# WRONG
LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s') % variable)
# RIGHT
LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s'), variable)

Change-Id: Ic5de802dc99d5d6d3f43b23006f97f6f73177ba3
"}]
commit_message:
Modify variable's using method in Log Messages

String interpolation should be delayed to be handled by the logging code,
rather than being done at the point of the logging call.
Ref:http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#log-translation
For example:
# WRONG
LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s') % variable)
# RIGHT
LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s'), variable)

Change-Id: Ic5de802dc99d5d6d3f43b23006f97f6f73177ba3

subject: Have inst-error delete before inst-create-wait
revisions:

Before we wait for the the instance-create stuff to finish,
make sure the error instances are deleted.   That will free

Do the same thing with the module- and cfggrp- instances
(before the backup ones are created).

Change-Id: I6c70975538f1e2f656c31cfaf63fc69e2be821c0

'}]
commit_message:
Have inst-error delete before inst-create-wait

Before we wait for the the instance-create stuff to finish,
make sure the error instances are deleted.   That will free
up resources faster and hopefully make the gate run quicker.

Do the same thing with the module- and cfggrp- instances
(before the backup ones are created).

Change-Id: I6c70975538f1e2f656c31cfaf63fc69e2be821c0
Depends-On: I3bbe3bafa7ea3e627272103ac16a38f6a32a8a06

commit_message:
Use test-config phase for configuring murano tempest

Since tempest removing its config due installation we need to
move our tempest config phase into test-config instead of extra
to avoid misconfigured tests on the end.

subject: Fix slow nodes causing guest_log to fail
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-30 21:24:12.000000000', 'files': ['trove/tests/scenario/runners/guest_log_runners.py'], 'message': "Fix slow nodes causing guest_log to fail

The gate is more often than not using very slow nodes.
This is causing failures in the guest_log in that more data
can be available to publish 'immediately' after a publish.
Some of these were fixed but others are now causing problems.

All checks for this are now set to include 'Partial' as a
valid state to avoid these remaining race conditions.

Change-Id: I736072d769b7b97082d1dc34d4b0cc567454deb7
Closes-Bug: 1646246
"}]
commit_message:
Fix slow nodes causing guest_log to fail

The gate is more often than not using very slow nodes.
This is causing failures in the guest_log in that more data
can be available to publish 'immediately' after a publish.
Some of these were fixed but others are now causing problems.

All checks for this are now set to include 'Partial' as a
valid state to avoid these remaining race conditions.

Change-Id: I736072d769b7b97082d1dc34d4b0cc567454deb7
Closes-Bug: 1646246

Tasks inheritance implemented

Tasks inheritance order described by parameter 'inherited'.
Inheritance order is calculated by C3 linearization algorithm
(Python MRO).

Implements: blueprint tasks-inheritance

commit_message:
[fuel-bootstrap]Add sample config files for fuel-bootstrap

* Remove any fuel-realated packages from default config
  that's mean, default fuel-bootstrap config will not build suitable
  bootstrap for fuel-master out of the box.
* Add sample config for trusty fuel-bootstrap

This patch require huge changes in fuel-library regarding fuel-master
deployment.

Partial-Bug: #1608925

Depends-on: I5bac895daf85bdc52b1672f53fec1b707db24473
Change-Id: Ib7206906b230d11a0cb5e58733d66976ccfe2fea
Implements: blueprint release-description-in-fuel-library

subject: Fixes murano-dashboard-coverage failing unit test.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-16 18:44:25.000000000', 'files': ['muranodashboard/tests/unit/environments/test_tables.py'], 'message': 'Fixes murano-dashboard-coverage failing unit test.

environments.test_tables.TestServicesTable.test_get_row_actions
throws an error when run in murano-dashboard-coverage-ubuntu-xenial.

The error happens because get_row_actions in the function under
testing contains an inner class that calls a Horizon function
that performs an API call, throwing the error:
'The default panel "environments" is not registered'.

This mocks out the Horizon function altogther, getting rid of the
error.

Change-Id: Id76b86f97024edb15fd9f093899649bd92fdd680
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes murano-dashboard-coverage failing unit test.

environments.test_tables.TestServicesTable.test_get_row_actions
throws an error when run in murano-dashboard-coverage-ubuntu-xenial.

The error happens because get_row_actions in the function under
testing contains an inner class that calls a Horizon function
that performs an API call, throwing the error:
'The default panel "environments" is not registered'.

This mocks out the Horizon function altogther, getting rid of the
error.

Change-Id: Id76b86f97024edb15fd9f093899649bd92fdd680

subject: Set grub device in /etc/default/grub
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-02 03:17:19.000000000', 'files': ['diskimage_builder/elements/bootloader/finalise.d/50-bootloader'], 'message': 'Set grub device in /etc/default/grub

Currently we run grub-mkconfig then go and edit the generated output
in /boot/grub/grub.cfg to override the "root=" arguments to our label.

If another element like project-config's
finalise.d/99-fix-grub-timeout then goes and re-runs grub2-install, it
overwrites these changes.

Grub seems to have GRUB_DEVICE which should override the root device.
Let's try using this.  Maybe it wasn't around at the time, this code
is more-or-less unchanged from
I7d83bb2b359e7a8c3858eca04c96e35cf4e1fe9e

Open question: what caused this to start breaking now?!

Change-Id: Ibaaa81124098f3c6febe48e455d3e1cd0a5f1761
'}]
commit_message:
Set grub device in /etc/default/grub

Currently we run grub-mkconfig then go and edit the generated output
in /boot/grub/grub.cfg to override the "root=" arguments to our label.

If another element like project-config's
finalise.d/99-fix-grub-timeout then goes and re-runs grub2-install, it
overwrites these changes.

Grub seems to have GRUB_DEVICE which should override the root device.
Let's try using this.  Maybe it wasn't around at the time, this code
is more-or-less unchanged from
I7d83bb2b359e7a8c3858eca04c96e35cf4e1fe9e

Open question: what caused this to start breaking now?!

Change-Id: Ibaaa81124098f3c6febe48e455d3e1cd0a5f1761

subject: Set timeout default to 0
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-02 03:17:19.000000000', 'files': ['diskimage_builder/elements/bootloader/finalise.d/50-bootloader', 'diskimage_builder/elements/bootloader/README.rst'], 'message': 'Set timeout default to 0

Set the grub timeout to zero by default, and add notes on how to
update this.  It seems like for most cases, you want to delay
boot-time by default.  This will stop infra having to carry an element
that goes and rewrites the grub configuration.

Change-Id: I556b3f48eff1b67ee8c4b9b64f749af95100fb99
'}]
commit_message:
Set timeout default to 0

Set the grub timeout to zero by default, and add notes on how to
update this.  It seems like for most cases, you want to delay
boot-time by default.  This will stop infra having to carry an element
that goes and rewrites the grub configuration.

Change-Id: I556b3f48eff1b67ee8c4b9b64f749af95100fb99

commit_message:
Skip larger than /64 subnets in DHCP agent

Dnsmasq can't handle these in IPv6 so we need to skip them to avoid
a whole bunch of log noise caused by continual retrying of issues.

Closes-Bug: #1645616
Change-Id: I36d167506cc45731e3f500a0c59b70b1bc27590f
(cherry picked from commit 028a349bc531cbcd91fd15f072be4b84952376b8)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2, 'name': 'Monty Taylor', 'email': 'mordred@inaugust.com', 'username': 'mordred'}, {'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 4162, 'name': 'Paul Belanger', 'email': 'pabelanger@redhat.com', 'username': 'pabelanger'}, {'_account_id': 4656, 'name': 'Sean M. Collins', 'email': 'sean@coreitpro.com', 'username': 'scollins'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 13252, 'name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott', 'display_name': 'Jens Harbott (frickler)', 'email': 'frickler@offenerstapel.de', 'username': 'jrosenboom'}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23184, 'name': 'DavidPurcell', 'email': 'd.purcell222@gmail.com', 'username': 'DavidPurcell'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-15 16:48:14.000000000', 'files': ['pkg/elasticsearch.sh', 'files/debs/general'], 'message': 'Use java version independent package on Ubuntu

Different versions of Ubuntu ship with different versions of Java.
Trusty had 7, Xenial has 8, and so on. This causes problems when we
hardcode a versioned package name into our dep lists as that version may
not exist everywhere. Thankfully Ubuntu provides a default-jre-headless
package that we can use instead that maps properly onto whatever java
version is correct.

Change-Id: I4e5da215c8f7aa426494686d5043995ce5d3c3af
'}]
commit_message:
Use java version independent package on Ubuntu

Different versions of Ubuntu ship with different versions of Java.
Trusty had 7, Xenial has 8, and so on. This causes problems when we
hardcode a versioned package name into our dep lists as that version may
not exist everywhere. Thankfully Ubuntu provides a default-jre-headless
package that we can use instead that maps properly onto whatever java
version is correct.

Change-Id: I4e5da215c8f7aa426494686d5043995ce5d3c3af

commit_message:
Only check connectivity to mirrors when defined

If nodepool configuration is not present or does not define a mirror
host, then avoid running network checks against it. Not all uses of
devstack-gate happen within nodepool-managed test systems.

Change-Id: I1932a72c3234b466c9e1c0ab5a09e93cda40a21e

On default, openstack used as demo user. Thus the CLI "openstack bare
metal node list" to show Ironic nodes will be denied. This patch is add
a parameter --os-username=admin to gain access right as the admin user
for CLI "openstack baremetal node list".

Related-Bug: #1650203

commit_message:
Fix ironic dev-quickstart doc bug

On default, openstack used as demo user. Thus the CLI "openstack bare
metal node list" to show Ironic nodes will be denied. This patch is add
a parameter --os-username=admin to gain access right as the admin user
for CLI "openstack baremetal node list".

Change-Id: I7a53d8594eb46a760b5614d6bd2d09749f41f31e
Related-Bug: #1650203

subject: Dynamically group Neutron OVS DVR to compute
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-12-15 14:44:15.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/inventory/env.d/nova.yml', 'playbooks/os-neutron-install.yml', 'playbooks/common-tasks/dynamic-grouping.yml'], 'message': 'Dynamically group Neutron OVS DVR to compute

Revert I3aaf8ced1ac406069f2d6e3b52b8d59eddda7eac to fix a bug where
deployments not using OVS+DVR contain unnecessary group mappings
that are filtered out within the Neutron role. Instead, we stop
adding these services to the compute host groups by default, and
conditionally add them when DVR is selected as the Neutron plugin.

Closes-Bug: #1645979
Change-Id: I543d1b5d3d50b6e7936605f436805d2f0ad9b3e9
'}]
commit_message:
Dynamically group Neutron OVS DVR to compute

Revert I3aaf8ced1ac406069f2d6e3b52b8d59eddda7eac to fix a bug where
deployments not using OVS+DVR contain unnecessary group mappings
that are filtered out within the Neutron role. Instead, we stop
adding these services to the compute host groups by default, and
conditionally add them when DVR is selected as the Neutron plugin.

Closes-Bug: #1645979
Change-Id: I543d1b5d3d50b6e7936605f436805d2f0ad9b3e9

        os_workers_small
        os_workers_large

os_workers will provide response times close to what

commit_message:
Update os_workers to have other options

Adding additional options for os_workers.rb:

        os_workers_small
        os_workers_large

os_workers will provide response times close to what
$::processorcount had (with two sockets machines).

os_workers_small will be the existing calculation.

os_workers_large can be used where services are distributed across
multiple machines and high worker count is not a concern.

Closes-bug: #1650424

Change-Id: I5dce760044d49ef9e3c88736c73cc267fd039ae7

subject: Fix crash-loop in thresholder caused by floating point numbers used as dimension filter
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-12-02 09:33:00.000000000', 'files': ['java/monasca-common-model/src/main/resources/monasca/common/model/alarm/AlarmExpression.g4'], 'message': 'Fix crash-loop in thresholder caused by floating point numbers used as dimension filter

Example: avg(some_timer{quantile=0.99}) > 0.1)

Changes:
* add DECIMAL (floating point value) to allowed tokens for dimensions

Without this fix, an alarm-definition like the above one once injected
through the Python API will break the Java-ORM layer because the
alarm-definition cannot be parsed by the generated ANTLR parser.
As a consequence the thresholder worker will terminate, leading to a
crash-cycle. I could not find a way to make the ORM-layer ignore
non-parseable alarm-definitions. So maybe this fix should be
complemented by an extension of the Python API that uses exactly the
same ANTLR grammar to validate incoming alarm-definitions.

Change-Id: Ibbd41e1b817ebadc74b1b4a677db898cfa173ccb
'}]
commit_message:
Fix crash-loop in thresholder caused by floating point numbers used as dimension filter

Example: avg(some_timer{quantile=0.99}) > 0.1)

Changes:
* add DECIMAL (floating point value) to allowed tokens for dimensions

Without this fix, an alarm-definition like the above one once injected
through the Python API will break the Java-ORM layer because the
alarm-definition cannot be parsed by the generated ANTLR parser.
As a consequence the thresholder worker will terminate, leading to a
crash-cycle. I could not find a way to make the ORM-layer ignore
non-parseable alarm-definitions. So maybe this fix should be
complemented by an extension of the Python API that uses exactly the
same ANTLR grammar to validate incoming alarm-definitions.

Change-Id: Ibbd41e1b817ebadc74b1b4a677db898cfa173ccb

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-19 16:16:31.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/api.pp', 'spec/classes/octavia_api_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Use correct section for host and port settings

The module configured the bind_host and bind_port as
part of the api section, which does not exist in config
reference. The correct section should be DEFAULT. With
the setting being in api, the api service starts up with
binding to host 127.0.0.1 instead of 0.0.0.0.

Change-Id: I90218f65cc60c546c7ef43d9f5a464d9e7031431
Closes-Bug: 1650837

commit_message:
Use correct section for host and port settings

The module configured the bind_host and bind_port as
part of the api section, which does not exist in config
reference. The correct section should be DEFAULT. With
the setting being in api, the api service starts up with
binding to host 127.0.0.1 instead of 0.0.0.0.

commit_message:
Add missing tests for the image v2 API

This commit adds missing test cases for the image v2 API, the missing
test cases are for listing images using different parameters for
filtering the lists.

This commit also fixes one test which was attempting to validate the
use of the container_format filter using a value that was not found
in the test environment.

Change-Id: Ia1369fa73f56ec290e868d3f2f2873785a70951d
Closes-Bug: 1086590

subject: Avoid double-check when waiting for test states
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-12-19 13:09:57.000000000', 'files': ['trove/tests/scenario/runners/instance_create_runners.py', 'trove/tests/scenario/groups/instance_create_group.py', 'trove/tests/scenario/runners/backup_runners.py', 'trove/tests/scenario/groups/__init__.py', 'trove/tests/int_tests.py', 'trove/tests/api/backups.py', 'trove/tests/scenario/groups/database_actions_group.py', 'trove/tests/scenario/groups/user_actions_group.py', 'trove/tests/scenario/runners/test_runners.py'], 'message': "Avoid double-check when waiting for test states

Sometimes tests fail becaused there's a double check for
the instance state.  If the state changes in between the
two checks, the test will fail to acknowledge the first
'correct' response and timeout while waiting for the state
to re-occur (which doesn't happen).

Sample output would look like:
[REPORT] Polling instance '<id>' for state 'REBOOT', was 'REBOOT'.
[REPORT] Polling instance '<id>' for state 'REBOOT', was 'ACTIVE'.
...
[REPORT] Polling instance '<id>' for state 'REBOOT', was 'ACTIVE'.
...
[REPORT] Status of instance '<id>' did not change to 'REBOOT' after 1201.3s.

Also broke down the instance-create tests into instance-create and
instance-init-create so that the initialzed instance won't
need to be created for manual runs or multi runs in the gate.

Reorganized the backup create so that on fast nodes there's
more chance that the backup is still around while the
negative tests run.

Change-Id: I9731bf7a93e7b8b3398cf73d1bc15d70f5bfa96a
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid double-check when waiting for test states

Sometimes tests fail becaused there's a double check for
the instance state.  If the state changes in between the
two checks, the test will fail to acknowledge the first
'correct' response and timeout while waiting for the state
to re-occur (which doesn't happen).

Sample output would look like:
[REPORT] Polling instance '<id>' for state 'REBOOT', was 'REBOOT'.
[REPORT] Polling instance '<id>' for state 'REBOOT', was 'ACTIVE'.
...
[REPORT] Polling instance '<id>' for state 'REBOOT', was 'ACTIVE'.
...
[REPORT] Status of instance '<id>' did not change to 'REBOOT' after 1201.3s.

Also broke down the instance-create tests into instance-create and
instance-init-create so that the initialzed instance won't
need to be created for manual runs or multi runs in the gate.

Reorganized the backup create so that on fast nodes there's
more chance that the backup is still around while the
negative tests run.

Change-Id: I9731bf7a93e7b8b3398cf73d1bc15d70f5bfa96a

subject: Separate hacking check factories
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 748, 'name': 'Armando Migliaccio', 'email': 'armamig@gmail.com', 'username': 'armando-migliaccio'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 5367, 'name': 'boden', 'email': 'bodenvmw@gmail.com', 'username': 'boden'}, {'_account_id': 6524, 'name': 'Henry Gessau', 'email': 'HenryG@gessau.net', 'username': 'gessau'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}, {'_account_id': 13995, 'name': 'Nate Johnston', 'email': 'nate.johnston@redhat.com', 'username': 'natejohnston'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 16, 'created': '2016-12-07 21:39:07.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_lib/hacking/checks.py', 'releasenotes/notes/separate-hacking-factories-6fc36b38de95662a.yaml', 'doc/source/usage.rst', 'neutron_lib/tests/unit/hacking/test_checks.py', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Separate hacking check factories

Neutron-lib adopters should be using neutron-lib's hacking
checks (factory) to validate compliance, but are susceptible
to breakage when new checks are released in neutron-lib (see
partial bug). What we need is a way to roll-out adopter hacking
checks in a controlled manner, giving consumers the opportunity
and tools to comply with new checks.

This patch begins to address this need by:
- Separating neutron-lib hacking checks into 3 separate factories;
adopter, incubating and neutron-lib internal (private).
- Moving any existing checks into their respective factory.
- Updating the usage docs on how to adopt our hacking checks.
- Trusty ole unit test; for obvious reasons.

This patch plays a part in a longer term hacking check strategy:
- Adopters must run neutron-lib's hacking check factory() or its
equivalent via their pep8 checks. This is part of their pep8 gate job
once they update their tox.ini to use neutron's factory().
- Adopters must run a non-voting neutron-lib-pep8-incubating gate job
that runs pep8 with neutron-lib's incubating_factory(). This is means
to warn adopters of upcoming checks without failing their gates.
This job will be created (by me) assuming reviewers agree to this approach.
- We'll communicate hacking checks via the standard means (see usage
docs herein).

Closure of Bug #1609478 will follow completion of the strategy above.

Partial-Bug: #1609478
Change-Id: I5b8d5c41f1bf463109baf9c26ae9d9db5719097d
"}]
commit_message:
Separate hacking check factories

Neutron-lib adopters should be using neutron-lib's hacking
checks (factory) to validate compliance, but are susceptible
to breakage when new checks are released in neutron-lib (see
partial bug). What we need is a way to roll-out adopter hacking
checks in a controlled manner, giving consumers the opportunity
and tools to comply with new checks.

This patch begins to address this need by:
- Separating neutron-lib hacking checks into 3 separate factories;
adopter, incubating and neutron-lib internal (private).
- Moving any existing checks into their respective factory.
- Updating the usage docs on how to adopt our hacking checks.
- Trusty ole unit test; for obvious reasons.

This patch plays a part in a longer term hacking check strategy:
- Adopters must run neutron-lib's hacking check factory() or its
equivalent via their pep8 checks. This is part of their pep8 gate job
once they update their tox.ini to use neutron's factory().
- Adopters must run a non-voting neutron-lib-pep8-incubating gate job
that runs pep8 with neutron-lib's incubating_factory(). This is means
to warn adopters of upcoming checks without failing their gates.
This job will be created (by me) assuming reviewers agree to this approach.
- We'll communicate hacking checks via the standard means (see usage
docs herein).

Closure of Bug #1609478 will follow completion of the strategy above.

Partial-Bug: #1609478
Change-Id: I5b8d5c41f1bf463109baf9c26ae9d9db5719097d

commit_message:
Gate fix for helm sometimes failing

Helm is currently being deployed before canal. This may sometimes
take too long to recover from this situation failing the gate.
This ps moves it till after canal has successfully launched.

Change-Id: I12ac6547756fef437c5c1f5b39c57940cf370bef

commit_message:
Add portgroup configuration fields

This change adds mode and properties fields into portgroup object
and adds a new API microversion to work with them.

It also makes portgroups' address field optional for all API
microversions.

Partial-Bug: #1618754
Change-Id: Id8c62fa56908040b0df16cc54c122ce2473a4587

commit_message:
Fix policy dict checkers

After the ironic context refactor, the default policy values were
changed to use project_domain_id and project_name, while not
changing the checker methods in API to fetch the correct values
from the context. This change fixes this issue.

Closes-Bug: #1650203
Change-Id: If9bf67b9d7d6f66b12a99d1ee7826af9634415b5

commit_message:
Add "update_access" interface support for VNX.

The VNX manila driver doesn't support the "update_access" API.
Add support for this API which implements following functions:
* Add a list of access rules.
* Remove a list of access rules.
* Recover access rules.

Change-Id: I49de0864e2f2c74d1b4d0f57fa0939a6d8c7c5df
Implements: blueprint vnx-manila-update-access

commit_message:
Fixing vswitchd crash

Entrypoint does not have exit binary as a result it was failing. Removing
COMMAND argument from entrypoint variables.

Change-Id: I437c7b6269837bd642345d6ac9a0037a59658ad8

commit_message:
Test plan delete with stack delete

We recently broke the plan delete but it is not checked anywhere in CI.
This change adds a plan delete to the overcloud delete which is tested
perodically.

Change-Id: I91cb266eb74981b8e2757f0dc431566d41cb7155
Depends-On: I33032c9e6f4a8cf002e65ebab60752c44fb5fdb2
Related-Bug: #1647747

commit_message:
H803 hacking have been deprecated

H803 hacking have been removed since hacking 0.10.
https://github.com/openstack-dev/hacking/blob/master/setup.cfg
test-requirements of networking-odl require hacking<0.11,>=0.10.0.
So remove H803 ignore statement
Closes-Bug: #1650903

Change-Id: Ibf62b9bade898773aff6494b980826a6293a260c

subject: Switch mistral to use authtoken configuration
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-10 22:59:28.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/services/mistral-base.yaml'], 'message': 'Switch mistral to use authtoken configuration

The upstream puppet module is adding the proper keystone authtoken
middleware support. This change updates THT to use the keystone
authtoken class rather than the deprecated settings. This also allows
for proper keystone v3 integration.

Change-Id: Iaf82716122a25e3e0785de1250d24edaaa5e4d04
Depends-On: I71969ef09018f9daa5f81c4f3bcbdb0b0974446c
'}]
commit_message:
Switch mistral to use authtoken configuration

The upstream puppet module is adding the proper keystone authtoken
middleware support. This change updates THT to use the keystone
authtoken class rather than the deprecated settings. This also allows
for proper keystone v3 integration.

Change-Id: Iaf82716122a25e3e0785de1250d24edaaa5e4d04
Depends-On: I71969ef09018f9daa5f81c4f3bcbdb0b0974446c

Patch - Id518a6d87d0949737cd1c50cb6a83149b85e5f85
remove the baremetal tests from tempest and so config
options.
New config options 'shared_physical_network' is being
added to check whether env support shared network or

But few tests are being skipped wrongly seems.

This patch fix those.

Change-Id: I59c757c3c32b961cdf92e393e01612115de5bdce
"}]
commit_message:
Few updates for baremtal dependent tests

Patch - Id518a6d87d0949737cd1c50cb6a83149b85e5f85
remove the baremetal tests from tempest and so config
options.
New config options 'shared_physical_network' is being
added to check whether env support shared network or
network isolation.

But few tests are being skipped wrongly seems.

This patch fix those.

Change-Id: I59c757c3c32b961cdf92e393e01612115de5bdce

commit_message:
Pin tempest to unblock CI scenarios

openstack/tempest/master interface breaks Trove and more services.
There is an attempt to fix it here:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/412511/
Let's pin Tempest until the fix works and is merged.

commit_message:
Add gnocchi support on undercloud

with ceilometer api being deprecated, we need gnocchi to process
metrics. This patch adds gnocchi on undercloud when telemetry
is enabled.

Implements: blueprint gnocchi-undercloud

commit_message:
Show team and repo badges on README

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.
The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and
features at first glance.

For more information about this effort, please read this email thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105562.html

To see an example of how this would look like check:

b'https://gist.github.com/faaad3def44c7a78e0eee86753134cd6\n'

Change-Id: I24b3a6d43dc5fb6ed404a1a8506b4bddc2ba9bb6

subject: Initial implementation of jsonschema validator
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-12-17 09:31:27.000000000', 'files': ['zun/common/validation/validators.py', 'zun/common/exception.py', 'zun/common/validation/__init__.py', 'zun/common/validation/parameter_types.py', 'zun/tests/unit/common/test_validations.py'], 'message': 'Initial implementation of jsonschema validator

This is the initial implementation of a jsonschema type
validator for the Zun API. By using jsonschema to validate API requests,
we can make parameters that are passed in fit the criteria we allow and
what is specified in the Zun API spec. This will also allow us to
validate parameters by wrapping the method that needs validation.

Partially-Implements: blueprint api-json-input-validation
Change-Id: Ia663e35d9744f19b4daff3f370a5831ac9205369
'}]
commit_message:
Initial implementation of jsonschema validator

This is the initial implementation of a jsonschema type
validator for the Zun API. By using jsonschema to validate API requests,
we can make parameters that are passed in fit the criteria we allow and
what is specified in the Zun API spec. This will also allow us to
validate parameters by wrapping the method that needs validation.

Partially-Implements: blueprint api-json-input-validation
Change-Id: Ia663e35d9744f19b4daff3f370a5831ac9205369

commit_message:
Skip 0.13.1 version of docutils

The 0.13.1 release breaks some documentation jobs
when it tries to build docs with remote images. This has been reported
upstream[0]. The version matches the supported docutils versions for
sphinx. The requirements patch is here: [1]

[0] https://sourceforge.net/p/docutils/bugs/301/
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/409529/

Change-Id: I0474d25b2d936c48c947bc78217af5a648b22f60

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1, 'name': 'James E. Blair', 'email': 'jim@acmegating.com', 'username': 'corvus'}, {'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5263, 'name': 'Jeremy Stanley', 'display_name': 'fungi', 'email': 'fungi@yuggoth.org', 'username': 'fungi', 'status': 'missing, presumed fed'}, {'_account_id': 6547, 'name': 'Andreas Jaeger', 'email': 'jaegerandi@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaegerandi'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-19 10:41:18.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Fix queue names

The zuul code only accepts job names, not a regex, for the job name
to name a queue using the queue-name option.

Fix the two usages of queue-name so that the queues are properly named.

Change-Id: I3741ae7f0504b157257a0d1e35dce8ea05562adf
'}]
commit_message:
Fix queue names

The zuul code only accepts job names, not a regex, for the job name
to name a queue using the queue-name option.

Fix the two usages of queue-name so that the queues are properly named.

Change-Id: I3741ae7f0504b157257a0d1e35dce8ea05562adf

commit_message:
Fix existing tarball-base for openstack-ansible-os_ironic

Since the validation check was added, existing releases for
OpenStack-Ansible will cause failues due to existing reference in the
openstack-ansible-os_ironic repository, that points to
openstack-ansible-ironic incorrectly.

Change-Id: I003508a59b3e38182d672a36745a7254dbc2f1bf

commit_message:
Skip network verification for bonds in round robin mode

Bond interfaces with 'balance-rr' mode are now skipped by network
verification task for bootstrap nodes as network checker does not
support this type of bonding.

Change-Id: I39b2c5916fd6f39548af0e41d8e7f877983f73a2
Closes-Bug: #1546520
(cherry picked from commit 5c3ed6ef0f6636d4b6d274f179dacec27a370b3c)

commit_message:
Create symlink which is required for master node plugin tasks

Place where plugins are linked depends on configuration (of Nailgun,
MCollective, Astute), hence must not be hardcoded in specs and
should be done by puppet manifests which own master node configuration
details.

Change-Id: I1e9db92f9fc8dc70403113d1d6f9062b689dd2ee
Related-bug: #1603987
Closes-bug: #1648882
(cherry picked from commit 0bb6ffbcb5ee6734fcf5dfd5f4dca20a5caa3b88)

commit_message:
Enable show_multiple_loations option for glance when using Ceph

When using Ceph as storage backend, to take the benefit of Ceph
inside snapshot, show_multiple_locations option needs to be enabled
so image snapshot can be done using ceph clone.

Change-Id: I8ecfcbd7b0df518f5dcf046693203bd7815efbb2
Closes-Bug: #1641572
(cherry picked from commit 220566bf6d2ad740bc55e35b7e559d60e17ef5f2)

commit_message:
Deprecate putting periodic tasks on a driver object

This approach will no longer make sense when the driver composition is in effect.
Anyway usually a better place to put a task is an interface.

Change-Id: I7096e428ce9774d89ac624c2d38bb23984a4b842
Related-Bug: #1524745

commit_message:
The driver composition reform

This spec suggests revamping how we name and compose drivers from interfaces.
It will allow having one vendor driver with options configurable per node
instead of many drivers for every vendor.

Partial-Bug: 1524745
Change-Id: I2754f9bb810f5e05a9c1e4625afb8f2589eeef74

Implements: blueprint add-lock-action-record

commit_message:
Add lock action record

The aim of this feature it to record lock/unlock action for audit, it
allow admin user to query who/when lock the server from action list.
In addition, this also make up the `locked_by` field which only store
"admin" or "owner", this feature can query user id from action list.

Change-Id: I44b1c7727e729aaff5da2be708801ba7e6635d55
Implements: blueprint add-lock-action-record

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-12-06 15:00:10.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/tests/lib/services/identity/v3/test_token_client.py', 'tempest/tests/lib/fake_identity.py'], 'message': 'Correct fake V3 token responses

A V3 token always contains audit_ids.

The V3 token catalog has region_id in addition to region (region
is deprecated).

Also, the V3 token has password_expires_at in the user.

See http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/identity/v3/index.html?expanded=password-authentication-with-scoped-authorization-detail

Change-Id: I426cf216cf6a8e348e6f0343e0f71b9766919f60
'}]
commit_message:
Correct fake V3 token responses

A V3 token always contains audit_ids.

The V3 token catalog has region_id in addition to region (region
is deprecated).

Also, the V3 token has password_expires_at in the user.

See http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/identity/v3/index.html?expanded=password-authentication-with-scoped-authorization-detail

Change-Id: I426cf216cf6a8e348e6f0343e0f71b9766919f60

subject: Show non-owner project servers
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-11-15 02:40:11.000000000', 'files': ['specs/ocata/approved/show-non-owner-servers.rst'], 'message': 'Show non-owner project servers

This feature adds the possibility to show a server which is not
current context project if permitted. The proposal is to add a new
flag ``--all-tenants`` in ``nova show`` subcommand. If ``--all-tenants``
is set to ``True``, we will find a server from all projects by id or
name.

bp show-server-all-tenants

Change-Id: I01859fa4694e1c88192447d04c5d52e53e48ad8d
'}]
commit_message:
Show non-owner project servers

This feature adds the possibility to show a server which is not
current context project if permitted. The proposal is to add a new
flag ``--all-tenants`` in ``nova show`` subcommand. If ``--all-tenants``
is set to ``True``, we will find a server from all projects by id or
name.

bp show-server-all-tenants

Change-Id: I01859fa4694e1c88192447d04c5d52e53e48ad8d

commit_message:
Remove extra 'u' from cli output

The unicode_key_value_to_string() function is designed to remove
extra 'u' in cinderclient cli output.
However this patch[1] bring the extra 'u' back.
Let's remove the extra 'u' again.

Closes-bug: #1615921
Closes-bug: #1606904

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/342734/
Change-Id: I26f0ad7149f57e935953c2398ba90b7b3585e201

commit_message:
move the undercloud deploy role from quickstart to quickstart-extras

In an effort to make more of the tripleo deployment ci more composable
it has been discussed to break out the undercloud deployment into it's
own role.  There are examples where additional configuration is needed
prior to the undercloud installation such as dpdk, and installing in
other ci environments.

Change-Id: I87fec6435f84490b9f9de8d2cc0dd9f186409d4d

dict as valid value types for any DictOfStringsField type field.

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-12-15 13:43:40.000000000', 'files': ['tests-py3.txt', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/storage/test_rbd.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/storage/rbd_utils.py'], 'message': "Port libvirt.storage.test_rbd to Python 3

* Stop explicitly encoding strings we pass to rbd: the library
  supports multiple string types now.
* We mock module rbd from rbd_utils.py, also need set module rbd's
  specific exceptions with object inherit from BaseException to avoid
  TypeError like: 'TypeError: catching classes that do not inherit from
  BaseException is not allowed'

Partially-Implements: blueprint goal-python35

Co-Authored-By: Davanum Srinivas <davanum@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I3eec213ad9bc13f0a371a5c4f28d3df377796125
"}]
commit_message:
Port libvirt.storage.test_rbd to Python 3

* Stop explicitly encoding strings we pass to rbd: the library
  supports multiple string types now.
* We mock module rbd from rbd_utils.py, also need set module rbd's
  specific exceptions with object inherit from BaseException to avoid
  TypeError like: 'TypeError: catching classes that do not inherit from
  BaseException is not allowed'

Partially-Implements: blueprint goal-python35

Co-Authored-By: Davanum Srinivas <davanum@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I3eec213ad9bc13f0a371a5c4f28d3df377796125

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-12-19 02:37:48.000000000', 'files': ['nova/cells/state.py'], 'message': "Fix error if free_disk_gb is None in CellStateManager

The field 'free_disk_gb' in Objects.ComputeNode can be nullable.
In CellStateManager._get_compute_hosts, we compute free_disk_mb
by 'free_disk_gb * 1024'. If the free_disk_gb is None, it will raise
a TypeError exception because None type can't multiply by an integer.
We should check this value, and if it's None, we just let it return
zero.

Closes-Bug: #1648983

Change-Id: I558d544ff838807c1d605cb5ed8d0e0fa97ab00e
"}]
commit_message:
Fix error if free_disk_gb is None in CellStateManager

The field 'free_disk_gb' in Objects.ComputeNode can be nullable.
In CellStateManager._get_compute_hosts, we compute free_disk_mb
by 'free_disk_gb * 1024'. If the free_disk_gb is None, it will raise
a TypeError exception because None type can't multiply by an integer.
We should check this value, and if it's None, we just let it return
zero.

Closes-Bug: #1648983

Change-Id: I558d544ff838807c1d605cb5ed8d0e0fa97ab00e

subject: Use new checks in hacking 0.12
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 5367, 'name': 'boden', 'email': 'bodenvmw@gmail.com', 'username': 'boden'}, {'_account_id': 6524, 'name': 'Henry Gessau', 'email': 'HenryG@gessau.net', 'username': 'gessau'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}, {'_account_id': 13995, 'name': 'Nate Johnston', 'email': 'nate.johnston@redhat.com', 'username': 'natejohnston'}, {'_account_id': 14611, 'name': 'dasm', 'display_name': 'dasm', 'email': 'dsmigiel@redhat.com', 'username': 'dasm'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-12-15 14:04:16.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_lib/hacking/checks.py', 'test-requirements.txt', 'doc/source/usage.rst', 'neutron_lib/tests/unit/hacking/test_checks.py', 'neutron_lib/hacking/translation_checks.py', 'releasenotes/notes/enable-hacking-check-H904-f512ecc98c0a4033.yaml', 'tox.ini', 'HACKING.rst'], 'message': "Use new checks in hacking 0.12

Neutron recently updated their usage of hacking to use
version 0.12 [1] that now contains the hacking check
check_delayed_string_interpolation who's off_by_default
value is initially True (i.e. disabled). This hacking check
is defined in neutron_lib, but hasn't been registered in our
factory and isn't being consumed directly [2].

This patch takes a simple approach to reusing openstack-dev
hacking checks:
- Removes all traces of neutron-lib's version of the check; no one is
using it [2].
- Bumps our version of hacking to use  0.12 so we can use the checks
in that release.
- Enables the check via enabled extensions in tox.ini as neutron did [1].
- Updates our hacking check usage, noting that adopters should
enable the same extensions we do (via tox.ini).

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/394817/
[2] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=check_delayed_string_interpolation&i=nope&files=&repos=

Change-Id: Ie9448317855b9cba6092cd0f63b77d26a562a5c9
"}]
commit_message:
Use new checks in hacking 0.12

Neutron recently updated their usage of hacking to use
version 0.12 [1] that now contains the hacking check
check_delayed_string_interpolation who's off_by_default
value is initially True (i.e. disabled). This hacking check
is defined in neutron_lib, but hasn't been registered in our
factory and isn't being consumed directly [2].

This patch takes a simple approach to reusing openstack-dev
hacking checks:
- Removes all traces of neutron-lib's version of the check; no one is
using it [2].
- Bumps our version of hacking to use  0.12 so we can use the checks
in that release.
- Enables the check via enabled extensions in tox.ini as neutron did [1].
- Updates our hacking check usage, noting that adopters should
enable the same extensions we do (via tox.ini).

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/394817/
[2] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=check_delayed_string_interpolation&i=nope&files=&repos=

Change-Id: Ie9448317855b9cba6092cd0f63b77d26a562a5c9

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-12-19 15:36:54.000000000', 'files': ['muranodashboard/common/utils.py'], 'message': 'Treat empty body as no body in parse_api_error

If BeautifulSoup is called when html5lib is installed, it will use
its parser when no markup_type is specified. In those cases, an empty
body is included in the parsed output when no dody is included in the
input string.

Change-Id: Ibc7201434b8f09b82cb96f5ffabceba4fbf74de7
Closes-Bug: #1650514
'}]
commit_message:
Treat empty body as no body in parse_api_error

If BeautifulSoup is called when html5lib is installed, it will use
its parser when no markup_type is specified. In those cases, an empty
body is included in the parsed output when no dody is included in the
input string.

Change-Id: Ibc7201434b8f09b82cb96f5ffabceba4fbf74de7
Closes-Bug: #1650514

With this patch following are done:-
- Configure Etcd with TLS support

Configure Following to commuicate with TLS enabled Etcd:-
- Flannel

Etcd also listens at http://127.0.0.1:2379, so on master nodes
etcdctl and kube apiserver can communicate without using
certificates.

if TLS_DISABLED="True" then TLS is not enabled for etcd.

Change-Id: I2147b67c4e346a4415e1f76c19ac68e94cb0a0fa
Partially-Implements: blueprint secure-etcd-cluster-coe
'}]
commit_message:
[k8s_fedora_atomic] Enable TLS in Etcd cluster

With this patch following are done:-
- Configure Etcd with TLS support

Configure Following to commuicate with TLS enabled Etcd:-
- Flannel

Etcd also listens at http://127.0.0.1:2379, so on master nodes
etcdctl and kube apiserver can communicate without using
certificates.

if TLS_DISABLED="True" then TLS is not enabled for etcd.

Change-Id: I2147b67c4e346a4415e1f76c19ac68e94cb0a0fa
Partially-Implements: blueprint secure-etcd-cluster-coe

subject: Add Constraints support
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-13 04:39:41.000000000', 'files': ['tools/tox_install.sh', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Add Constraints support

Adding constraints support to libraries is slightly more complex than
services as the libraries themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove oslo.rootwrap.

Change-Id: Ie14167eced0bba29f7d4e30f815785641c1da6c0
"}]
commit_message:
Add Constraints support

Adding constraints support to libraries is slightly more complex than
services as the libraries themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove oslo.rootwrap.

Change-Id: Ie14167eced0bba29f7d4e30f815785641c1da6c0

commit_message:
Add a new Hardware Manager for CNA network card

This patch adds a new hardware manager, which will disable the embedded
LLDP agent on Intel CNA network cards in order to allow the gathering of
LLDP data during the inspection process.

Change-Id: I572756ac6a7bf67a7f446738ba9d145e1c1bdc48
Closes-Bug: #1623659

commit_message:
Remove unneeded 'reserved' filter in cleaning stuck nodes

We just clear all reservations before doing this on conductor start,
so it's unnecessary to filter it again.

commit_message:
Remove pointless doc-publisher-site parameter

Across the entirety of our job config corpus, we only ever set the
doc-publisher-site parameter to docs.openstack.org. Instead just set
it directly in the publishers where it's needed and reduce
unwarranted confusion for people writing job configs.

Change-Id: I87a17ee7de618361f12a025d23629b7d5d711810

subject: Remove pointless tarball-site parameter
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-19 14:49:55.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/gerrit-plugin-jobs.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/pypi-jobs.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/python-jobs.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/signing-jobs.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/javascript.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/maven-plugin-jobs.yaml', 'dev/jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/jenkins-plugin-jobs.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/macros.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/oaktree.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/gerrit.yaml'], 'message': "Remove pointless tarball-site parameter

Across the entirety of our job config corpus, we only ever set the
tarball-site parameter to tarballs.openstack.org. Instead just set
it directly in the publishers where it's needed and reduce
unwarranted confusion for people writing job configs. This also
allows us to get rid of the parameterized sites in the tarball,
wheel and war publishers.

Change-Id: I31109f41177b8c07177d7ed8ef16cbfd135131ef
"}]
commit_message:
Remove pointless tarball-site parameter

Across the entirety of our job config corpus, we only ever set the
tarball-site parameter to tarballs.openstack.org. Instead just set
it directly in the publishers where it's needed and reduce
unwarranted confusion for people writing job configs. This also
allows us to get rid of the parameterized sites in the tarball,
wheel and war publishers.

Change-Id: I31109f41177b8c07177d7ed8ef16cbfd135131ef

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-13 04:50:38.000000000', 'files': ['lib/keystone'], 'message': 'Always add the service role to service users

When creating a service user we allow the user to be created with a
different role. Currently in auth_token middleware we want to check that
the service token is specified with the service role so we should always
add the service role and optionally add additional roles.

Change-Id: Ie954a679674b4795079b539ebc8d4d2dcbd7dacc
'}]
commit_message:
Always add the service role to service users

When creating a service user we allow the user to be created with a
different role. Currently in auth_token middleware we want to check that
the service token is specified with the service role so we should always
add the service role and optionally add additional roles.

Change-Id: Ie954a679674b4795079b539ebc8d4d2dcbd7dacc

commit_message:
Fully support MAC address change on CreateEndpoint

An optional MAC address can be provided by libnetwork when calling
NetworkDriver.CreateEndpoint. Whenever present, such
MAC address is only taken into account and actually set on new Neutron
port creates, while ignored on Neutron port updates.

This patch adds support for updating the provided MAC address in
_update_port, similarly to _create_port, and makes their coding style
more consistent.

Change-Id: Ic81aca8fffceadecc05849bbe84e9b859d97ee4f
Signed-off-by: Marco Chiappero <marco.chiappero@intel.com>

commit_message:
Add a type for the ControlVirtualIP resource

This patch adds a new type called:
  OS::TripleO::Network::Ports::ControlPlaneVipPort

This defaults to a normal OS::Neutron::Port object but can
be mocked out for some implementations like when installing
the undercloud where neutron doesn't exist.

Change-Id: Iebf2428432a98a9d789b206ce973599adbc0af8f

This commit makes ironic tempest tests be skipped if ironic is disabled
within tempest.conf

This would allow to disable *only* the ironic tempest tests in an
environment where multiple projects containing in-tree plugins are
installed. As the tempest in-tree plugins are discovered using their
project's setup.cfg entry points, a user wanting to run tempest and not
using virtualenvs would be able to disable the execution. This covers as

Change-Id: I1ffcfa71fbc401d9eed03f53e6ad3792177e9ca8
"}]
commit_message:
Skip tempest tests if ironic isn't available

This commit makes ironic tempest tests be skipped if ironic is disabled
within tempest.conf

This would allow to disable *only* the ironic tempest tests in an
environment where multiple projects containing in-tree plugins are
installed. As the tempest in-tree plugins are discovered using their
project's setup.cfg entry points, a user wanting to run tempest and not
using virtualenvs would be able to disable the execution. This covers as
well the the usescase where tempest is installed from an OS package.

Change-Id: I1ffcfa71fbc401d9eed03f53e6ad3792177e9ca8

This adds the ability to set the DNS for the undercloud. This

commit_message:
Add option to set DNS name servers on the undercloud

This adds the ability to set the DNS for the undercloud. This
introduces the undercloud_undercloud_nameservers variable which can
be set in in two ways:

* Setting it to a string will just set the configuration to that
  given value as-is.
* Setting it to a list of DNS servers will join the list with ',' as
  separators; This is done to fit with the oslo.config's ListOpt
  format.

As expected, not setting this value will just leave the configuration
option blank.

Co-Authored-By: Juan Antonio Osorio Robles <jaosorior@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I98fc4baca0b935cbf8ee19b71921769ea041c164
Depends-On: I2b8a3f64dc1958f00b0471b68ba8283da76a4e7b

commit_message:
VirtualBMC support for tripleo-quickstart

This patch is replacing the usage of the pxe_ssh driver in Ironic in
favor of pxe_ipmitool + VirtualBMC*. The main reason for this patch is
because the pxe_ssh driver is already marked as unsupported and will be
removed from Ironic upstream at the end of the Ocata release.

Older releases: Liberty, Mitaka and Newton will continue to rely on the
pxe_ssh driver.

* VirtualBMC is a proxy that converts IPMI commands to libvirt calls

Partial-Bug: #1645733
Change-Id: Iaaa9fc1fd593cbce045456f4341c461a8eea82ad

commit_message:
Sync debian-sysmaint password

For mysql under debian we should have configured mysql-user debian-sys-maint
for proper logrotate operation, etc. Right now we have desynchronization
between password stored in debian.cnf and in mysql database.

Closes-Bug: 1650283
Change-Id: I55d0a7c44980d7ebbd9606c08bb0a744f265feec

commit_message:
Update MTU on existing devices

This patch makes OVS and Linuxbridge interface drivers to set MTU on
plug() attempt if the device already exists. This helps when network MTU
changes (which happens after some configuration file changes).

This will allow to update MTU values on agent restart, without the need
to bind all ports to new nodes, that would involve migrating agents. It
will also help in case when you have no other nodes to migrate to (in
single node mode).

Both OVS and Linuxbridge interface drivers are updated.

Other drivers (in-tree IVS as well as 3party drivers) will use the
default set_mtu implementation, that only warns about the missing
feature (once per process startup).

DocImpact suggest to restart agents after MTU config changes instead of
          rewiring router/DHCP ports.

Related: If438e4816b425e6c5021a55567dcaaa77d1fffff
Related: If09eda334cddc74910dda7a4fb498b7987714be3
Closes-Bug: #1649845
Change-Id: I3c6d6cb55c5808facec38f87114c2ddf548f05f1

commit_message:
Ensure random object unique constraints aren't violated

The unit test framework for objects generates random values
for the objects it creates. We need to pay attention to
previously generated values to avoid using the same value
for data models that have unique constrains.

Closes-Bug: #1650615
Change-Id: I0c54b0d82b8c15f2740cce5a850c8fa50acba536

commit_message:
ppc64el: fix for grub2 missing package

Then pkg-mapping missing for the ppc64el ubuntu
image for grub2.

This fix adds the package mapping explicitly so
that name_map is populated with the 'ieee1275'
package name for grub2 on ubuntu ppc64el.

Change-Id: Id2b0f63a7015f883070fd59b79fd96a1c024858a
Closes-Bug: #1624021

subject: Run `yum update -y` before Puppet run
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 12715, 'name': 'John Trowbridge', 'email': 'trown@redhat.com', 'username': 'trown'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-12-17 14:51:08.000000000', 'files': ['elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.pp', 'instack_undercloud/undercloud.py', 'elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.yaml.template', 'instack_undercloud/tests/test_undercloud.py'], 'message': "Run `yum update -y` before Puppet run

This patch run `yum update -y` right before running os-refresh-config
(Puppet).

1) Running `yum` from an Exec in Puppet is a bad idea because Puppet has
no idea which packages resources are touched, so we're loosing the
orchestration control.

2) We need to ensure that `yum update -y` runs before any attempt to
deploy OpenStack services, so we have latest packages from RDO and
CentOS.

Change-Id: Ifbbbdbf1f0c569791abc712913c7e0f6bbe533d9
Closes-Bug: #1650374
"}]
commit_message:
Run `yum update -y` before Puppet run

This patch run `yum update -y` right before running os-refresh-config
(Puppet).

1) Running `yum` from an Exec in Puppet is a bad idea because Puppet has
no idea which packages resources are touched, so we're loosing the
orchestration control.

2) We need to ensure that `yum update -y` runs before any attempt to
deploy OpenStack services, so we have latest packages from RDO and
CentOS.

Change-Id: Ifbbbdbf1f0c569791abc712913c7e0f6bbe533d9
Closes-Bug: #1650374

commit_message:
RAX partprobe fix

RAX seems to have an issue where partprobe fails. This change
has partprobe executed only on the loopback devices rather then
rescan everything.

subject: Failing test (mac osx) - test_cache_ephemeral
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-16 14:04:04.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_imagebackend.py'], 'message': 'Failing test (mac osx) - test_cache_ephemeral

Test test_cache_ephemeral fails on mac osx with the following traceback.

    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "mock/mock.py", line 1305, in patched
        return func(*args, **keywargs)
      File "test_imagebackend.py", line 773, in test_cache_ephemeral
        ephemeral_size=size_gb, size=size)
      File "imagebackend.py", line 206, in cache
        fileutils.ensure_tree(base_dir)
      File "oslo_utils/fileutils.py", line 40, in ensure_tree
        os.makedirs(path, mode)
      File "python2.7/os.py", line 150, in makedirs
        makedirs(head, mode)
    OSError: [Errno 21] Is a directory: '/'

Change-Id: I695ccae534d2f53fdace3f7bb4bc1df953d712d3
'}]
commit_message:
Failing test (mac osx) - test_cache_ephemeral

Test test_cache_ephemeral fails on mac osx with the following traceback.

    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "mock/mock.py", line 1305, in patched
        return func(*args, **keywargs)
      File "test_imagebackend.py", line 773, in test_cache_ephemeral
        ephemeral_size=size_gb, size=size)
      File "imagebackend.py", line 206, in cache
        fileutils.ensure_tree(base_dir)
      File "oslo_utils/fileutils.py", line 40, in ensure_tree
        os.makedirs(path, mode)
      File "python2.7/os.py", line 150, in makedirs
        makedirs(head, mode)
    OSError: [Errno 21] Is a directory: '/'

Change-Id: I695ccae534d2f53fdace3f7bb4bc1df953d712d3

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-06 17:44:58.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/manager.py', 'cinder/scheduler/rpcapi.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/scheduler/test_rpcapi.py'], 'message': "Block 3.1 message with c-sch RPCAPI pinned to 3.0

notify_service_capabilities was sent unconditionally, even when we
shouldn't allow it due to RPC version pinning. This commit blocks that
message when RPC API is pinned to anything lower than 3.1.

Change-Id: Ib2e4f65f626cad79773f46077a75813f434cb806
Closes-Bug: 1647789
"}]
commit_message:
Block 3.1 message with c-sch RPCAPI pinned to 3.0

notify_service_capabilities was sent unconditionally, even when we
shouldn't allow it due to RPC version pinning. This commit blocks that
message when RPC API is pinned to anything lower than 3.1.

Change-Id: Ib2e4f65f626cad79773f46077a75813f434cb806
Closes-Bug: 1647789

subject: add --missing-milestone flag to list-deliverables
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-16 14:21:39.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_releases/deliverable.py', 'openstack_releases/cmds/list_deliverables.py'], 'message': 'add --missing-milestone flag to list-deliverables

This argument can be used to query for cycle-with-milestones
deliverables that have not yet tagged a specific milestone.

Also fix a bug in the logic for determining the latest release.

Change-Id: Ibe71cdd60e5ccdd03cec3bc7148c2bafc2bf2c5a
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
add --missing-milestone flag to list-deliverables

This argument can be used to query for cycle-with-milestones
deliverables that have not yet tagged a specific milestone.

Also fix a bug in the logic for determining the latest release.

Change-Id: Ibe71cdd60e5ccdd03cec3bc7148c2bafc2bf2c5a
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
